body.name: GIGABYTE AORUS GeForce RTX 3080 Xtreme WATERFORCE WB 10G (REV 2.0) Graphics Card, Water Block Cooling System, LHR, 10GB 320-bit GDDR6X, GV-N3080AORUSX WB-10GD REV2.0 Video Card
body.stockDetail: Only 1 left in stock - order soon.
body.description: NVIDIA Ampere Streaming Multiprocessors 2nd Generation RT Cores 3rd Generation Tensor Cores Powered by GeForce RTX 3080 Integrated with 10GB GDDR6X 320-bit memory interface WATERFORCE Water Block cooling system Leak detection RGB Fusion 2.0 3x DisplayPort 1.4 & 3x HDMI 2.1 Protection metal back plate 4 Years Warranty (Online registration required) Core Clock: 1845 MHz. Get the ultimate gaming performance with AORUS RTX 3080 Graphics Cards. Powered by NVIDIA's 2nd gen RTX architecture and refined with WATERFORCE Water Block Cooling System technology, the AORUS GeForce RTX 3080 XTREME WATERFORCE WB 10G (rev. 2.0) brings stunning visuals, amazingly fast frame rates, and AI acceleration to games and creative applications with its enhanced RT Cores and Tensor Cores, and superfast G6X memory.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: About Us GIGABYTE offers a comprehensive product lineup that aims to “Upgrade Your Life.” With expertise encompassing consumer, business, gaming, and cloud systems, GIGABYTE established its reputation as one of the leaders in the industry with products including motherboards, graphics cards, laptops, mini PCs, monitors, and other PC components and accessories. GIGABYTE is poised to extend our scope in business servers and cloud systems with hardware and software solutions that integrate AI and AloT applications to allow to capture, analyze, and transform digital information into economic data, accelerating businesses' success from edge to cloud.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2022
reviews.reviewText: tarjeta es muy buena funciona muy muy bien

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not enough power for flagship card. Decent for an OEM waterblock
reviews.reviewText: No need to review the 3080 part. That’s been throughly covered.The main things to note about this card are:1) Only has two 8pin connectors. That’s not enough OC overhead for a card that is not only watercooled but represents Gigabytes top of the line series of video cards. Trying to push the OC makes the card unstable-random system crashes. Even though temps are low and the system seems stable for a few hours.2) The G1/4 openings are designed for traditional 13/10 (1/2”-3/8”) size fittings. Larger fittings may contact against the leak protection circuit and cause a system crash. Leak feature can only be disabled by pulling out the two pin connector.3) Plating inside the waterblock comes off over time and discolors your tubing. It leaves a muddy copper colors residue on tubing that can only partially be removed. You’ll need to replace your tubing unless you used something like glass or opaque tubing. This happens even with a through pre clean. It might be possible to avoid by pre stripping the platting off in advance by soaking the block in a mild acid like vinegar. But I didn’t try that.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars So far good
reviews.reviewText: So far it has been working correctly, has some issues during installation with some leak but the card survived after drying , the loos are great, the only bad point so far is the Gigabyte software for the lightning effects, it is not compatible with any other rgb software as icue ,armory crate or synapse and it crashes when launched simultaneously . Was able to get around that by only starting the Gigabyte software setting the effect (not smart) and then closing all services and starting other softwares.With this being said the temp of the vram is higher than i would wanted it to be, will be a 5 star product id the software was not so buggy and the vram was cooler.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Used and defective item listed as new.
reviews.reviewText: Product came in used and defective after being listed as new. After returning I was hit with a $190 restocking fee. Very disappointed in the sales experience.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars This card is JUNK!
reviews.reviewText: I am now on my third card. First one was causing blue screens from the start. Replaced and the second card wouldn't bluescreen but had the infamous crash to desktop dwm.exe stopped. Replaced that card, now on my third card and it has graphical rendering issues. No over clocking at all. Liquid cooled and card gets no higher than 38-42 Celsius on extreme use. Gigabyte customer support takes 5-7 days to respond to an RMA request and since their hacking, their processes are just horrible. Stay away from from the 12GB and 10GB Revision 2 cards. They will fail you!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars DO NOT BUY
reviews.reviewText: Died after two months, poorly made ruined my entire loop

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Outstanding Graphics! Great Look too!
reviews.reviewText: The 3080 is a powerhouse of a graphics card. What else can I say. You won't be disappointed in the outstanding video quality this produces. Being already attached to a water block saves time and hassle too, if you're planning on a water cooling build.As for the seller MCI Electronics, they were great!The outer seal on the box was split on arrival. I was concerned I was receiving a used graphics card or a returned item. I immediately contacted the seller, who sent me a pic of the item that was sealed before shipping. They helped alleviate my fears of it being used or a retuned item. And said that the seal was probably damaged in shipping. I opened the item and found that it was not used, but did have some small holes in the static bag along the sharp edges of the card, and also the items in the box had been jostled. It did correlate that the box was bounced around during shipping. After discussing it with the seller I opted to keep the card and try it out once my computer was built. I am happy to report that the GPU works well and I am a happy customer so far. I appreciate the fast and professional responses from MCI Electronics. I would consider them to be a trustworthy seller of computer parts. I would offer the advice of better packing in the future for such an expensive item though.
Me pareció excelente, hay que tener un poco de experiencia con sistemas de refrigeración liquida, trabaja de maravilla y el RGB que trae incorporado hace que se vea hermosa, hay que cazarla en oferta
